Suzanne Katherine Yalof and Marc Alan Schwartz were married last evening by Rabbi Barry Friedman at Bridgewaters in New York.

Mrs. Yalof Schwartz, 33, is the executive fashion director of Glamour magazine and the author of ''Getting Over John Doe: A Story of Love, Heartache and Surviving With Style'' (William Morrow, 1999). She graduated from Simmons College.

The bride is a daughter of Ina and Herbert Yalof of New York. Her father is the chief executive of Urban Archaeology, a maker and retailer of lighting and bathroom fixtures. He was a president of Macy's Northeast from 1979 to 1990. Her mother is the author of ''Straight From the Heart: Letters of Hope and Inspiration From Breast Cancer Survivors'' (Kensington Books, 1998).

Mr. Schwartz, 31, is a vice president for acquisitions at the Internet Capital Group, a venture capital firm in Boston. He graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University and received an M.B.A. from Stanford University. He is a son of Linda Schwartz and Dr. Arthur Schwartz of Potomac, Md. His mother, a psychotherapist, has a private practice in Chevy Chase, Md., and is chairwoman of the psychotherapy division of the Washington Psychoanalytic Foundation. His father, an ophthalmologist, is a partner in Washington Eye Physicians and Surgeons in Chevy Chase and the director of the glaucoma service of the Washington Hospital Center.
